alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:38PM EDT until July 05 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream and creek flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream and creek flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Washouts likely on area ATV trails and dirt roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Calais, Pembroke, Meddybemps, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Dennysville, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper, Marion and Edmunds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
